questions.question: The council ………………….. chosen its chairman.
questions.description: A collective noun takes a singular verb when the collection is thought of as a whole.

questions.question: The majority ……………… against the verdict.
questions.description: A collective noun takes a singular verb when the collection is thought of as a whole.

questions.question: The wages of sin …………………… death.
questions.description: Some verbs are plural in form, but singular in number. Wages is one of them.

questions.question: Each of the sisters ……………………. pretty.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Neither of the men ………………… able to solve the puzzle.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: Justice as well as mercy …………… it.
questions.description: When another noun is joined to a singular noun by as well as, the verb is singular in number.

questions.question: The quality of the mangoes …………….. not good.
questions.description: Here we use a singular verb because the subject is the singular noun quality.

questions.question: John as well as his team mates ………………. praise.
questions.description: When another noun is joined to a singular noun by as well as, the verb is singular in number.

questions.question: You, who ……………….. my friend, should stand by me.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause should agree with its antecedent in number and person.

questions.question: Neither his father nor his mother ……………….. alive.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: The jury ………………… divided in their opinion.
questions.description: A collective noun usually takes a singular verb but when the reference is to the members of the group, it sometimes takes a plural verb.

questions.question: I, who ……………….. your friend, will guard your interests.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause should agree with its antecedent in number and person.
